problem_text:
Let W(x, y) be a non-trivial reduced group word, and G one of the groups PSL(2, R), PSL(2, C), or SO(3, R). Are all the maps W : G × G → G surjective?
For SL(2, R), SL(2, C), GL(2, C), and for the group S3 of quaternions of norm 1 there exist non-surjective words; see (J. Mycielski, Amer. Math. Monthly, 84 (1977), 723–726; 85 (1978), 263–264).
J. Mycielski
